profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-07-12T09:47-0400

did.unittitle: Thaddeus W. Maliszewski collection
did.abstract: Thaddeus W. Maliszewski a lawyer, military officer, civic leader, was born in Hartford in 1922 and died in 2009. Graduate of Hillyer Junior College (Hartford), Wesleyan University (Middletown, Conn.) and University of Connecticut Law School. During WWII he served in the Pacific, was a member of the National Guard and Governor's Military Staff, finished his military career in the rank of Brigadier General. He served as a judge for several courts, was very active in the Democratic Party. For many years served in different positions in the Polish American Congress on state and national level. In addition, Maliszewski was active in veterans' organizations, Polish American cultural organizations as well as in political organizations. The collection consists of his personal and professional papers along with information about Poland and Polish American culture.

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: Material in this collection is arranged by series and within each series by date.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Thaddeus Walenty Maliszewski, referred to as “Ted” by most, was born on January 22, 1922 in Hartford, CT to Joseph Maliszewski and Apolonia Hajdasz as one of thirteen children. He attended Polish parochial school SS. Cyril & Methodius and then went on to Burr Jr. High, Bulkeley High, Hillyer Jr. College, West Virginia Wesleyan, Wesleyan University, and the University of Connecticut School of Law. During his schooling he was involved in several organizations, serving as a leader in most of them on top of his achievements in the National Honors Society and Student Council. He was a member of Troop 41 and served as Patrol Leader, Assistant Scoutmaster and Eagle Scout. He served in the army during WWII in the South Pacific Theatre and received an honorable discharge as a Sergeant in 1946. He was commissioned a 2nd Lieutenant in 1949 and promoted to Colonel in the CT National Guard. In 1951 he married Barbara Karpienia and they had six children. Maliszewski practiced law since 1950 in a private law office, the Windsor court system, and in the Judge Advocate Corps of the Connecticut National Guard. He retired from the army in 1967 after 21 years of service. Maliszewski was very involved in Polonia by holding positions in organizations, participating in activities for the rights of Polish Americans, such as anti-defamation campaigns, and publishing his writing. He was a member of several organizations, notably the Polish American Congress, where he was active on national and state level, the American Council of Polish Cultural Clubs (ACPCC, later called the American Council of Polish Culture or ACPC), and Polish Legion of American Veterans (PLAV). In the PLAV he was vice-commander for Zone 1 (New England, New York and New Jersey) and in the PAC he was a National Director and the Connecticut district president. He also participated heavily in Democratic Party activities and campaigning on a local, state, and federal level in addition to serving as Windsor Town Chairman for many time. After retirement he and Barbara moved to Florida where he was a member of The Polish Cultural Society of Palm Beaches (PCSPB) and The Pulaski Legion of American-Polish Veterans and Auxiliary of Lake Worth, Inc. Thaddeus W. Maliszewski died on September 14, 2009 and is burried at the Cedar Hill Cemetery in Hartford.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Cite as: Thaddeus W. Maliszewski collection (CPAA 86-04). Connecticut Polish American Archives, Central Connecticut State University, New Britain.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: The material in the collection was donated by Thaddeus W. Maliszewski in 1986. There were several later donations which included materials on the same time period as well as the newer material. Last donation was made by Mr. Maliszewski in July of 2009.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of personal and professional papers of Thaddeus W. Maliszewski (notated as TWM in finding aid). There are personal correspondence, official documents, reports, photographs, newspaper clippings and pamphlets relating to his life, organizations he participated in, politics, and his career practicing law. Some organizations include the American Council of Polish Cultural Clubs (ACPCC), Polish Legion of American Veterans (PLAV), Polish American Congress (PAC), The Polish Cultural Society of Palm Beaches (PCSPB), The Pulaski Legion of American-Polish Veterans and Auxiliary of Lake Worth, Inc. and others. Included is also plentiful information about Poland, Polish culture, and Polish- American life in Connecticut and throughout the country. The collection spans from approximately 1935 to 2004.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Preliminary inventory for the collection was done in 1996. Later a microsoft word document was created with a list of material in the collection. In 2011 collection was reprocessed and finding aid was created using Archivist Toolkit.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Archival Materials note
relatedmaterial.p: For related material go to the following collections: Polish Cultural Club of Greater Hartford records (CPAA 86-30) American Council for Polish Culture Collection (CPAA 96-03) Joseph L. Zazyczny collection of American Council for Polish Culture records CPAA 99-15

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
